title: Python Basics
description: Test your knowledge of Python fundamentals

questions.question: What is the correct way to create a comment in Python?
questions.explanation: In Python, comments start with the # symbol. Everything after # on that line is ignored by the Python interpreter.

questions.question: Complete the code to print 'Hello, World!':
questions.explanation: The print() function outputs text to the console. Strings can be enclosed in single or double quotes.

questions.question: Python is case-sensitive.
questions.explanation: Python is case-sensitive, meaning 'Variable' and 'variable' are treated as different identifiers.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid Python variable name?
questions.explanation: Variable names cannot start with a number. '2nd_variable' is invalid because it starts with '2'.

questions.question: What will this code output?
questions.explanation: The code adds 5 + 3 = 8 and prints the result.
